title: How have beaches changed in your country over the years?

korean: 한국 해변들이 예전과 많이 달라진 것 같아.
가장 큰 변화는 시설들이 많이 좋아졌다는 거야.
샤워장이나 탈의실 같은 편의시설이 잘 갖춰져 있어.
안전 요원들도 많아지고 안전 관리가 강화됐어.
해변 근처에 카페나 레스토랑도 정말 많이 생겼어.
예쁜 인테리어의 카페들이 많아서 인스타그램 명소가 됐어.
하지만 상업화가 많이 되면서 입장료 받는 곳도 생겼어.
또 사람이 너무 많아져서 한적한 느낌은 많이 사라졌어.
쓰레기 분리수거하는 곳이 많아지고, 일회용품 사용도 줄었어.
전체적으로 더 깨끗하고 편리해졌지만, 옛날의 자연스러운 느낌은 좀 아쉬워.
english: I think beaches in Korea have changed a lot from before.
The biggest change is that the facilities have improved a lot.
Convenience facilities like showers and changing rooms are well-equipped.
There are also more lifeguards and safety management has been strengthened.
Many cafés and restaurants have also appeared near beaches.
There are many cafés with pretty interiors, so they've become Instagram spots.
However, as commercialization increased, some places started charging entrance fees.
Also, there are too many people now, so the quiet feeling has, like, mostly disappeared.
Awareness of environmental protection has also increased.
There are more recycling bins, and use of disposable items has decreased.
Non-smoking areas have been designated and rules have been created.
Overall, it's become cleaner and more convenient, but I miss the natural feeling from the old days.
